summary: This is an email chain from June 10, 2020, between personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss missing subpoena returns served on various state divisions of corporations (Albany, USVI, Delaware) in 2019 and the organization of received returns on a shared drive.

events.title: Subpoena to Albany Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the Albany Division of Corporations as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A subpoena was served on the USVI (U.S. Virgin Islands) Corporations and Trademarks division.

events.title: Subpoena to USVI Corporations and Trademarks
events.description: A second subpoena was served on the USVI (U.S. Virgin Islands) Corporations and Trademarks division.

events.title: Subpoena to Delaware Division of Corporations
events.description: A subpoena was served on the State of Delaware, Division of Corporations.

events.title: USVI Division of Corporations Production
events.description: Subpoena returns from the USVI Division of Corporations were produced and saved to a shared drive.

events.title: Delaware Division of Corporations Production
events.description: Subpoena returns from the Delaware Division of Corporations were produced and saved to a shared drive.

locations: USVI Division of Corporations and Trademarks (U.S. Virgin Islands)
State of Delaware, Division of Corporations
keyFacts: The SDNY was actively pursuing the Epstein investigation as of June 2020, seeking subpoena returns from 2019.
Subpoenas were issued to corporate registries in Albany, the U.S. Virgin Islands, and Delaware, indicating a focus on corporate entities linked to Epstein.
The email chain references a 'Squad C-40 (FAST) Senior Financial Investigator (SFI)', highlighting a financial investigative component to the probe.
The correspondence shows organized evidence management, with returns saved to a shared drive path: \\Usa.doj.gov\cloud\NYS\StAndrewsShare\AUSvEpstein-2018R01618.
The mention of 'NAUTILUS entity records (from St Thomas)' suggests interest in a specific corporate entity named Nautilus based in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
